text: Seffa () is a Maghrebi dish of sweetened semolina cuscus with butter, cinnamon, and almonds. It can also be made with rice or vermicelli. This dish is generally consumed at the end of a meal, before dessert. It is often served at traditional marriage ceremonies and family gatherings. Seffa can also be served with chicken () or with raisins (). There are also sweetened cuscus dishes besides seffa, such as mesfouf. == See also == * Algerian cuisine * Moroccan cuisine == References == Category:Pastries Category:Algerian cuisine Category:Moroccan cuisine Category:WikiProject Africa articles Category:WikiProject Morocco articles Category:WikiProject Algeria articles
title: Seffa
